events.title: PSG vs Paris FC - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 17- Mini Match
events.desc: Two clubs from the Paris region will face each other for the first time in Ligue 1 since 25 February 1990, when Paris SG met Racing Paris. If Racing are considered being based in Colombes, this will be the first Ligue 1 match between two clubs from the same city since Paris SG-Paris FC on 17 December 1978. This will be the third meeting in all competitions between Paris Saint-Germain and Paris FC, following two draws in Ligue 1 in 1978. Paris Saint-Germain have not lost any of their last 38 home games against a promoted side in Ligue 1, with their last defeat coming against Montpellier on 15 May 2010.

events.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) - Cincinnati Open 2025 - ATP 1000
events.desc: World No. 1 Jannik Sinner, holder of four Masters 1000 titles and 20 ATP singles trophies, comes into the Cincinnati final after winning two titles this season, including the Australian Open and Wimbledon. Across the net stands Carlos Alcaraz, with seven Masters crowns, 21 career titles, and five tournament victories already in 2025. Their rivalry remains one of the sport’s most exciting, with Alcaraz leading the head-to-head 8–5.

events.title: Espanyol vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18
events.desc: Espanyol have not won any of their last 28 LaLiga games against Barcelona. Only two teams have gone 29 or more consecutive matches without a win against the same opponent in the competition's history: Real Sociedad against Real Madrid between 1957 and 1979  and Hércules also against Real Madrid between 1940 and 1984. FC Barcelona are unbeaten in their last 16 away LaLiga games against Espanyol, since a 3-1 defeat in January 2007 at the Lluís Companys. This run is only surpassed by Villarreal  as their longest away unbeaten streak against the same opponent in the competition's history.

events.title: Havre AC vs Angers - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 17
events.desc: Le Havre AC have lost two of their last three home games against Angers in all competitions, after winning 13 of the previous 14. Le Havre have failed to score in their last four Ligue 1 matches and could equal their longest such drought, dating back to November 1987-February 1988.

events.title: Melbourne City FC (AUS) vs Sanfrecce Hiroshima (JPN) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East M
events.desc: This will be the first-ever AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Melbourne City and Sanfrecce Hiroshima; City are winless in each of their two games against Japanese opposition in the competition, while a win for Sanfrecce would see them beat Australian opponents in three consecutive games for the first time in competition history. Melbourne City are winless in each of their last three matches in the AFC Champions League Elite, their longest such run in the competition; in fact, they have begun each of their previous two campaigns in the competition with draws.

events.title: EN Spirit of Sport Series 11 | E2
events.desc: This month on Spirit of Sport, Real Madrid and England footballer Jude Bellingham takes us back to the start of his journey in Birmingham and opens up about his mental health. Ahead of the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina, freestyle skier Eileen Gu reflects on her journey to gold. Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar and tennis icon Novak Djokovic spotlight the transformative power of sport and how they’re using their platforms to give back. England Lioness Georgia Stanway visits a special football project in London to inspire the next generation.

events.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) - Cincinnati Open 2025 - ATP 1000
events.desc: World No. 1 Jannik Sinner, holder of four Masters 1000 titles and 20 ATP singles trophies, comes into the Cincinnati final after winning two titles this season, including the Australian Open and Wimbledon. Across the net stands Carlos Alcaraz, with seven Masters crowns, 21 career titles, and five tournament victories already in 2025. Their rivalry remains one of the sport’s most exciting, with Alcaraz leading the head-to-head 8–5.

events.title: Everton vs Wolverhampton Wanderers - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 21
